subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Silk Road Trial: Defining Online Criminal Liability
description: Learn The Silk Road Trial: Defining Online Criminal Liability in one minute.

hook.text: Ross Ulbricht built a website. He never touched the drugs, weapons, or stolen data sold on it. He got life in.

buildup.text: Silk Road was the first major dark web marketplace. Ulbricht (Dread Pirate Roberts) was charged with.

discovery.text: The prosecution argued Ulbricht was responsible for all crimes facilitated by the platform, although he didn't.

twist.text: Two federal agents investigating Silk Road were themselves convicted of stealing Bitcoin during the investigation.

climax.text: The Silk Road trial set precedent: platform operators are liable for criminal activity they knowingly facilitate online.

punchline.text: The investigators were also criminals. Truth is stranger than fiction.

quiz.question: What legal precedent did the Silk Road trial establish?
options: Dark web marketplaces are legal if they use cryptocurrency
Platform operators are liable for criminal activity they knowingly facilitate
